com.satori.rtm

Interface RtmClient


  • public interface RtmClient
    The RtmClient interface is the main entry point for accessing the RTM Service, including publish and subscribe operations.

    Create an instance of the client with RtmClientBuilder.RtmClientBuilder(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) and use the RtmClient methods to start, stop, and restart the client WebSocket connection, and publish and subscribe to channels. 

     
 RtmClient client = new RtmClientBuilder(ENDPOINT, APP_KEY)
           .setListener(new RtmClientAdapter() {
                // overridden methods go here
            )}
           .build();
            //  other logic

 client.start();
 client.createSubscription("test-channel", SubscriptionMode.SIMPLE,
     new SubscriptionAdapter() {
      // overridden methods go here
     });
 client.publish("test-channel", "Hello, world");

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start()
        Starts the client. Client tries to establish the WebSocket connection to the RTM Service asynchronously.

        If you enable auto-reconnect mode, the SDK attempts to reconnect to the RTM Service if the WebSocket connection fails for any reason.

        If you make any publish or subscribe requests while the WebSocket connection is not active, the SDK queues the requests and completes them when the connection is established or re-established.

        You can use the RtmClientListener interface to define application functionality for when the application enters or leaves the connecting state.

        See Also:
        RtmClientListener.onEnterConnecting(RtmClient)

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops the client. The SDK tries to close the WebSocket connection asynchronously and does not start it again unless you call start().

        Use this method to explicitly stop all interaction with the RTM Service.

        You can use the RtmClientListener interface to define application functionality when the application enters or leaves the stopped state.

        See Also:
        RtmClientListener.onEnterStopped(RtmClient)

      • restart

        void restart()
        Restarts the client.
        See Also:
        start(), stop()

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Shuts down the client. Stops the client, terminates threads, and cleans up all allocated resources.

        You cannot use the instance of the RtmClient when it is shut down.

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        Returns true if the client is completely connected.

        The client is connected when underlying WebSocket transport is established, any authentication (if necessary) is completed and the client is in an active state and able to send and receive messages.

        Returns:
        true if the client is completely connected; false otherwise.

      • createSubscription

        void createSubscription(java.lang.String channel,
                        java.util.EnumSet<SubscriptionMode> modes,
                        SubscriptionListener listener)
        Creates subscription with the specific channel.

        You can create subscription at any time. The SDK manages the subscription and sends a subscribe request when the WebSocket connection is established. Use the subscriptionConfig parameter to define the behaviour that the SDK uses to handle dropped connections.

        Subscribe and unsubscribe operations always produce either an OK response or an error response from the RTM Service.

        Parameters:
        channel - Name of the channel.
        modes - Subscription modes.
        listener - Subscription listener.
        See Also:
        SubscribeRequest

      • createSubscription

        void createSubscription(java.lang.String channelOrSubId,
                        SubscriptionConfig subscriptionConfig)
        Creates subscription to the specified subscription id.

        You can create subscription at any time. The SDK manages the subscription and sends a subscribe request when the WebSocket connection is established. Use the subscriptionConfig parameter to define the behaviour that the SDK uses to handle dropped connections.

        Subscribe and unsubscribe operations always produce either an OK response or an error response from the RTM Service.

        If filter is not specified then channelOrSubId is used as a channel name.

        Parameters:
        channelOrSubId - Name of the channel or subscription id.
        subscriptionConfig - Subscription configuration.
        See Also:
        SubscribeRequest

      • removeSubscription

        void removeSubscription(java.lang.String subscriptionId)
        Removes the subscription with the specific subscription id.

        The RTM Service continues to send messages for the channel until the unsubscribe operation completes.

        You can use the SubscriptionListener interface to define application functionality for when the application enters or leaves the unsubscribing, unsubscribed, or deleted state.

        Parameters:
        subscriptionId - Name of the channel to unsubscribe from.
        See Also:
        SubscriptionListener.onEnterUnsubscribing(UnsubscribeRequest), SubscriptionListener.onEnterUnsubscribed(UnsubscribeRequest, UnsubscribeReply), SubscriptionListener.onDeleted()

      • publish

        <T> com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Pdu<PublishReply>> publish(java.lang.String channel,
                                                                                  T message,
                                                                                  Ack ack)
        Publishes the message to the channel.

        If client is not connected to the RTM Service, the publish request is queued. The SDK sends the message when the connection is established. The length of this queue is limited by RtmClientBuilder.setPendingActionQueueLength(int).

        Use the ListenableFuture object, for example, with the Future.get() method or use the Futures.addCallback(ListenableFuture, FutureCallback) method to set a callback and process the response from the RTM Service.

        The ListenableFuture can fail due to one of the following errors during the publish operation:

        • IllegalStateException: The message cannot be added to the pending queue because the queue is full.
        • PduException: The reply from the RTM Service is not a positive confirmation.
        • TransportException: An error occurred in the WebSocket transport layer.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of serializable message.
        Parameters:
        channel - Name of the channel to publish to.
        message - Serializable JSON value.
        ack - Acknowledge mode.
        Returns:
        Asynchronous result of the publish request.
        See Also:
        PublishRequest, PublishReply, RtmClientBuilder.setPendingActionQueueLength(int)

      • getConnection

        Connection getConnection()
        Returns the current connection or null if the client is not connected.
        Returns:
        Connection, or null if client is not connected.

      • read

        com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Pdu<ReadReply>> read(java.lang.String key)
        Reads the value of the specified key from a key-value store.
        Parameters:
        key - Key name.
        Returns:
        Asynchronous result of the read request.
        See Also:
        read(ReadRequest)

      • read

        com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Pdu<ReadReply>> read(ReadRequest request)
        Reads the value of the key specified in a ReadRequest instance from a key-value store.

        If client is not connected to the RTM Service, the read request is queued. The SDK reads the message when the connection is established. The length of this queue is limited by RtmClientBuilder.setPendingActionQueueLength(int).

        The ListenableFuture returned by this method is complete when the SDK receives the value from the RTM Service.

        The ListenableFuture can fail due to one of the following errors during the read operation:

        • IllegalStateException: The request cannot be added to the pending queue because the queue is full.
        • PduException: The reply from the RTM Service is not a positive confirmation.
        • TransportException: An error occurred in the WebSocket transport layer.
        Parameters:
        request - The read request.
        Returns:
        Asynchronous result of the read request.

      • write

        <T> com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Pdu<WriteReply>> write(java.lang.String key,
                                                                              T value,
                                                                              Ack ack)
        Writes the value for the specified key to a key-value store.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of serializable message.
        Parameters:
        key - Key name.
        value - Serializable JSON value.
        ack - Acknowledge mode.
        Returns:
        Asynchronous result of the write request.
        See Also:
        write(WriteRequest, Ack)

      • write

        <T> com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Pdu<WriteReply>> write(WriteRequest<T> writeRequest,
                                                                              Ack ack)
        Writes the value of the key in a WriteRequest instance to a key-value store.

        If client is not connected to the RTM Service, the write request is queued. The SDK sends the request when the connection is established. The length of this queue is limited by RtmClientBuilder.setPendingActionQueueLength(int).

        The ListenableFuture returned by this method is complete when the SDK receives the acknowledgement from the RTM Service.

        The ListenableFuture can fail due to one of the following errors during the write operation:

        • IllegalStateException: The request cannot be added to the pending queue because the queue is full.
        • PduException: The reply from the RTM Service is not a positive confirmation.
        • TransportException: An error occurred in the WebSocket transport layer.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of serializable message.
        Parameters:
        writeRequest - Write request.
        ack - Acknowledge mode.
        Returns:
        Asynchronous result of the write request.
        See Also:
        WriteRequest, WriteReply

      • delete

        com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Pdu<DeleteReply>> delete(java.lang.String key,
                                                                            Ack ack)
        Deletes the value of the specified key from a key-value store.

        If client is not connected to the RTM Service, the delete request is queued. The SDK sends the request when the connection is established. The length of this queue is limited by RtmClientBuilder.setPendingActionQueueLength(int).

        The ListenableFuture returned by this method is complete when the SDK receives the acknowledgement from the RTM Service.

        The ListenableFuture can fail due to one of the following errors during the delete operation:

        • IllegalStateException: The request cannot be added to the pending queue because the queue is full.
        • PduException: The reply from the RTM Service is not a positive confirmation.
        • TransportException: An error occurred in the WebSocket transport layer.
        Parameters:
        key - Key name.
        ack - Acknowledge mode.
        Returns:
        Asynchronous result of the write request.
        See Also:
        DeleteRequest, DeleteReply

      • search

        void search(java.lang.String prefix,
            Callback<Pdu<SearchReply>> callback)
        Returns all channels with a given prefix. Server could send several responses.
        Parameters:
        prefix - The channels prefix.
        callback - A user-supplied callback to execute when the response has been received from the RTM service.
